form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Donnelly (for himself, Mr. Cruz, Mr. Blunt, and Mr. Leahy) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To establish a tiered hiring preference for members of the reserve components of the Armed Forces.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Reserve Jobs Act of 2015.

section.header: Tiered preference eligibility for members of reserve components of the armed forces

subsection.header: Preference eligibility for members of reserve components of the armed forces
subsection.text: Section 2108 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (G)(iii), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (H), by adding and at the end; and
by inserting after subparagraph (H) the following:

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (5), by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:
qualified reservist means an individual who is a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces on the date of the applicable determination—

clause.text: has completed at least 6 years of service in a reserve component of the Armed Forces; and
in each year of service in a reserve component of the Armed Forces, was credited with at least 50 points under section 12732 of title 10; or
has completed at least 10 years of service in a reserve component of the Armed Forces; and
in each year of service in a reserve component of the Armed Forces, was credited with at least 50 points under section 12732 of title 10; and

paragraph.text: reserve component of the Armed Forces means a reserve component specified in section 101(27) of title 38.

subsection.header: Tiered hiring preference for members of reserve components of the armed forces
subsection.text: Section 3309 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (2), by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:
a preference eligible described in section 2108(6)(B)—3 points; and
a preference eligible described in section 2108(6)(A)—2 points.

subsection.text: Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to Congress a report that—

paragraph.text: assesses Federal employment opportunities for members of a reserve component of the Armed Forces;
evaluates the impact of the amendments made by this section on the hiring of reservists and veterans by the Federal Government; and
provides recommendations, if any, for strengthening Federal employment opportunities for members of a reserve component of the Armed Forces.
